intro: Leptarrhena amplexifolia, commonly known as the clasping-leaved daisy, is a perennial shrub native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its dense, bushy growth habit. The plant features small, white to pale yellow flowers that are clustered in heads, surrounded by narrow, clasping leaves. Its foliage is often covered in fine, silky hairs, giving it a distinctive texture. Leptarrhena amplexifolia is well adapted to dry, rocky environments and is often used in rock gardens due to its ornamental value.
